chapter.title: Quick start with the recommended profile
Run analysis in GitHub
chapter.note: This feature is in experimental mode, which means that its operation can be unstable.
chapter.p: In GitHub, %product% is implemented as the Qodana Scan GitHub Action.To configure the Qodana Scan GitHub Action, save the .github/workflows/code_quality.yml file containing the workflow configuration:
chapter.code:
name: Qodana on: workflow_dispatch: pull_request: push: branches: - main - 'releases/*'
jobs: qodana: runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v3 with: fetch-depth: 0 - name: 'Qodana Scan' uses: JetBrains/qodana-action@v2022.3.3
chapter.p: Using this workflow, Qodana will run on the main branch, release branches, and on the pull requests coming to your repository.
chapter.note: fetch-depth: 0 is required for checkout in case Qodana works in pull request mode (reports issues that appeared only in that pull request).
chapter.p: Because Qodana Scan is experimental, you may need to additionally configure the pr-mode parameter in the with section:
By default, Qodana Scan uses the experimental mode of the Qodana for .NET linter. If you are experiencing issues with it, you can report an issue in our bug tracker.
To authorize in Qodana Cloud and forward reports to it, follow these steps:

step.p: In the GitHub UI, create the QODANA_TOKEN encrypted secret and save the project token as its value.
In a GitHub workflow, add this snippet to invoke the Qodana Scan action:
step.code: - name: 'Qodana Scan' uses: JetBrains/qodana-action@v2022.3.3 env: QODANA_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.QODANA_TOKEN }}

chapter.title: Inspect projects using private NuGet repositories
chapter.p: %linter% does not support authentication for private NuGet repositories using, for example, Windows Authentication. To overcome this limitation, you can place all required packages within the %product% cache as shown below:

procedure.step: In the local filesystem, create the folder that will contain cache. For example, it can be C:/Temp/QodanaCache.

Copy all NuGet packages contained by default in the %userprofile%\.nuget\packages folder to C:/Temp/QodanaCache/nuget. If you have a custom package folder, copy packages from that folder instead of %userprofile%\.nuget\packages.
Run %product% using the --cache-dir C:/Temp/QodanaCache once more.
